info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:27PM PDT until August 24 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PDT FOR WEST CENTRAL IMPERIAL COUNTY... At 426 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles southeast of Ocotillo Wells, or 15 miles north of Plaster City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Imperial County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
